trans-unit.source: Generate an API app client
trans-unit.target: Generate an API app client

trans-unit.source: The API App tools in Visual Studio make it easy to generate C# code that calls to your Azure API Apps from desktop, store, and mobile apps.
trans-unit.target: The API App tools in Visual Studio make it easy to generate C# code that calls to your Azure API Apps from desktop, store, and mobile apps.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the solution that contains the API app from the [Create API app](../article/app-service-api/app-service-dotnet-create-api-app.md) topic.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the solution that contains the API app from the [Create API app](../article/app-service-api/app-service-dotnet-create-api-app.md) topic.

trans-unit.source: From **Solution Explorer**, right-click the solution and select the **Add** > **New Project**.
trans-unit.target: From **Solution Explorer**, right-click the solution and select the **Add** > **New Project**.

trans-unit.source: Add a new project
trans-unit.target: Add a new project

trans-unit.source: In the **Add New Project** dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the **Add New Project** dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Select the **Windows Desktop** category.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Windows Desktop** category.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Console Application** project template.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Console Application** project template.

trans-unit.source: Name the project.
trans-unit.target: Name the project.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to generate the new project in your existing solution.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to generate the new project in your existing solution.

trans-unit.source: Add a new project
trans-unit.target: Add a new project

trans-unit.source: Right-click the newly created console application project and select **Add** > **Azure API App Client**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the newly created console application project and select **Add** > **Azure API App Client**.

trans-unit.source: Add a new Client
trans-unit.target: Add a new Client

trans-unit.source: In the **Add Microsoft Azure API App Client** dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the **Add Microsoft Azure API App Client** dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Select the **Download** option.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Download** option.

trans-unit.source: From the drop-down list, select the API app that you created earlier.
trans-unit.target: From the drop-down list, select the API app that you created earlier.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Generation Screen
trans-unit.target: Generation Screen

trans-unit.source: The wizard will download the API metadata file and generate a typed interface for invoking the API App.
trans-unit.target: The wizard will download the API metadata file and generate a typed interface for invoking the API App.

trans-unit.source: Generation Happening
trans-unit.target: Generation Happening

trans-unit.source: Once code generation is complete, you'll see a new folder in Solution Explorer, with the name of the API app.
trans-unit.target: Once code generation is complete, you'll see a new folder in Solution Explorer, with the name of the API app.

trans-unit.source: This folder contains the code that implements the client and data models.
trans-unit.target: This folder contains the code that implements the client and data models.

trans-unit.source: Generation Complete
trans-unit.target: Generation Complete

trans-unit.source: Open the **Program.cs** file from the project root and replace the **Main** method with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Open the **Program.cs** file from the project root and replace the **Main** method with the following code:

trans-unit.source: Test the API app client
trans-unit.target: Test the API app client

trans-unit.source: Once the API app has been coded, it's time to test the code.
trans-unit.target: Once the API app has been coded, it's time to test the code.

trans-unit.source: Open **Solution Explorer**.
trans-unit.target: Open **Solution Explorer**.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the console application you created in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the console application you created in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: From the console application's context menu, select **Debug > Start new instance**.
trans-unit.target: From the console application's context menu, select **Debug > Start new instance**.

trans-unit.source: A console windows should open and display all of the contacts.
trans-unit.target: A console windows should open and display all of the contacts.

trans-unit.source: Running console app
trans-unit.target: Running console app

trans-unit.source: Press **Enter** to dismiss the console window.
trans-unit.target: Press **Enter** to dismiss the console window.
